channel.title: Changing training exp
channel.description: [b]hi, ive just downloaded a new server sourch and the exp on my server is too fast, it goes up kinda slow but i want it a bit slower so its more fun and challenging. can you help me out? thanks[/b]

item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

DUDE. YOU KILL NPC’S IN TESTSCAPE FOR EXPERIENCE, NOT CLICK ON OBJECTS. THAT’S WHY YOU CAN’T FIND THE CASES.

Sorry I just got kinda mad there. -.-

item.title: Changing training exp
item.dc:creator: @NojTB NojTB
item.description:
@NojTB wrote:

thats why im asking for a testscape guide. the cases
case 823
case 1531
and case 299 have nothing to do with the dummy haybail or door at all

this is what they are

				case 823:
					Amount1 = 10;
					Amount2 = Amount1;
					Status = 4;
					fletching[1] = 67;
					fletching[2] = 150;
					fletching[4] = 810;
					break;












            case 1531:
                if (playerLevel[15] >= 67) { // identifying Lantadyme
                addSkillXP(140, 15);
                deleteItem(1531, GetItemSlot(1531), 1);
                sendMessage("You identify the herb");
                addItem(2481, 1);
                } else if (playerLevel[15] < 67) {
                sendMessage("You aren't high enough herblore to identify this herb");
                }
                GoOn = false;
                break;

case 299 nor 229 dont even exist

item.title: Changing training exp
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

NojTB:

ya i can train on objet, and i dont want to be able to. thats problem.

Delete the cases then. Just find the case in client.java and delete it. Say, a Dummy gives Attack exp, it would start like this

case 823:

and finish like this (usually)

break;

So the case, at the start = object id. Just search the object id that gives experience and you’re more than likely to be able to delete/modify/find it.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing training exp
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

[quote=“NojTB, post:5, topic:92613”]Edited: stil guide doesent help with my darn testscape source problem on that, is there a testscape guide on how to change this?

i cant find any of the guide you got there in the client.java[/quote]

Because the 1st one is for Phonescape, same with the bottom one, except the bottom one is slightly modified. Testscape, you can’t train on objects (yet). Just add the cases and you’ll be able to.

item.title: Changing training exp
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Lol, that’s my server. -.- Here, I’ll get the stuff for you to search for.

case 823: if (actionTimer == 0) { setAnimation(422); addSkillXP((35*playerLevel[0]), 0); actionTimer = 57; } break;

Attack ^^^^^

case 411: if (actionTimer == 0) { setAnimation(422); addSkillXP((35*playerLevel[5]), 5); actionTimer = 57; } break;

Not sure ^^^^^

case 9611: if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) { if (actionTimer == 0) { setAnimation(3141); addSkillXP((65*playerLevel[6]), 6); actionTimer = 57; } }

Mage I think ^^^

case 2514: if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You imagine firing at the target.. You gain Range experience!"); actionName = "range1"; actionTimer = 57; setAnimation(426); addSkillXP((65*playerLevel[4]), 4); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } break;

Range ^^^^^

case 4889: if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) { if(actionTimer == 0) { actionTimer = 57; setAnimation(776); addSkillXP((35*playerLevel[2]), 2); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } } break;

Strength I think ^^^^

case 299: if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) { if(actionTimer == 0) { addSkillXP((35*playerLevel[1]), 1); actionTimer = 57; setAnimation(0x320); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } } break;

Defence I think ^^^^^

Hope that helped.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing training exp
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Purpose : To answer you’re question (5 Minute tut ftw)

Difficulty : 1/10

Assumed Knowledge : Searching blah-blah-blah…

Server Base : Any

Classes Modified : client.java

Procedure
Step 1 - Attack : [i] Go into you’re client.java and search for case 823:

You should see something like this below it if (actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You Attack The Dummy."); setAnimation(0x326); addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[0]), 0); addSkillXP((300*playerLevel[3]), 3); addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[18]), 18); actionTimer = 12; } break;

To change the experience gained just change the 150, 300 and the other 150.

Step 2 - Strength : [i] Go into you’re client.java and search for case 1531:

Below that you should see something like this if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) { if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You start hitting the door"); actionTimer = 20; setAnimation(0x326); addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[2]), 2); addSkillXP((300*playerLevel[3]), 3); addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[18]), 18); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } } break;

To change the experience ganied again, change the 150 and the 300.

Step 3 - Defence : [i] Go into you’re client.java and search for case 299:

You should see something like this below it [code]if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) {
if(actionTimer == 0)
{
sendMessage(“You Dig In The Stack And Get Xp!”);
addSkillXP((150playerLevel[1]), 1);
addSkillXP((150playerLevel[18]), 18);
actionTimer = 20;
setAnimation(0x320);
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}
}
break;

Again, change the 2 150’s to alter the experience gained.[/code]

Step 4 - Magic : [i] Go into you’re client.java and search for Varrock

Until you see something like this below it [code] {
teleX = 3489;
teleY = 3288;
addSkillXP((20*playerLevel[6]), 6);
newheightLevel = 0;
}

 if (s == "Falador")
 {
    teleX = 2964;
    teleY = 3378;
    addSkillXP((30*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 0;
         
 }

 if (s == "Lumby")
 {
    teleX = 3222;
    teleY = 3218;
    addSkillXP((40*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

 if (s == "Camelot")
 {
    teleX = 2757;
    teleY = 3477;
   addSkillXP((50*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

 if (s == "Ardougne")
 {
    teleX = 2662;
    teleY = 3305;
    addSkillXP((120*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 0;
    
 }

 if (s == "Watchtower")
 {
    teleX = 2549;
    teleY = 3113;
    addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 0;
    
 }

 if (s == "Trollheim")
 {
    teleX = 2480;
    teleY = 5174;
    addSkillXP((400*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

 if (s == "Ape")
 {
    teleX = 2761;
    teleY = 2784;
    addSkillXP((400*playerLevel[6]), 6);
    newheightLevel = 1;
 }
if (s == "Paddewwa"){

    teleX = 3131; 
    teleY = 9912;
    addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

if (s == “Senntisten”){

    teleX = 3312; 
    teleY = 3376;
    addSkillXP((200*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

if (s == “Kharyrll”){

    teleX = 3493; 
    teleY = 3485;
    addSkillXP((25*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }
if (s == "Lasaar"){

    teleX = 3007; 
    teleY = 3477;
    addSkillXP((350*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }
if (s == "Carrallangar"){

    teleX = 3161; 
    teleY = 3671;
    addSkillXP((400*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

if (s == “Annakarl”){

    teleX = 3288; 
    teleY = 3886;
    addSkillXP((550*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }

if (s == “Ghorrock”){

    teleX = 3091;
    teleY = 3963;
    addSkillXP((650*playerLevel[playerMagic]), playerMagic);
    newheightLevel = 0;
 }[/code]

To change the experience gained by teleporting each time, change all the numbers with *'s next to them.

Step 5 - Range : [i] Go into you’re client.java and search for case 2514:

You should see something like this below it if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You shoot at the target."); actionName = "range1"; actionTimer = 30; setAnimation(426); addSkillXP((7*playerLevel[4]), 4); addSkillXP((5*playerLevel[18]), 18); addItem(3272, 1); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } break;

Again, change the numbers with the *'s beside them to change the Range experience gained.

Credits : ME ME ME

Hope that helped you dude. :o

Read full topic
